data.content:
verb
-scales; -scaled; -scaling
[+ obj] US :to make (something) smaller
The company has downscaled production. [=the company is making fewer products]
The festival will have to be downscaled this year.
adjective
[more ~; most ~] US :relating or appealing to people who do not have much money
an apartment in a downscale neighborhood
The company aims to reach a more downscale market with its new stores. also; :of low quality
downscale [=(chiefly Brit) down-market] products
